video.title: PATIENTS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS ARE LESS LIKELY TO RECEIVE ORGAN TRANSPLANTS
video.description: More than 25 thousand people in the United States undergo organ transplants each year.   Disparities in access to care and getting placed on waiting lists for organ transplantation can be a problem for some patients. Now a new study finds that depending on where you live, you may be less likely to receive the organ transplant you need.
